title: avro-protocol
description: JSON Schema for an Apache Avro protocol, version 1.11.3
$comment: The current structure, using an allOf+if/then combination and copying the definitions from the schema JSON-schema is needed due to two bugs: https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/WEB-64286/JSON-Schema-completion-not-evaluating-if-and-pattern-conditionals-correctly and https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/WEB-23543

schema.description: An Avro schema; either a schema name, anonymous (primitive type, annotated primitive type, array, map, union) or named (fixed, enum, record/error)

type.description: The type of the schema; can be a record/error, enum, fixed, array, map or primitive type

x-intellij-enum-metadata.null: no value; used in unions to make values optional
x-intellij-enum-metadata.map: a map of values by string keys
x-intellij-enum-metadata.enum: a named type with explicit values (symbols)
x-intellij-enum-metadata.error: a named type with fields, thrown my protocol messages

logicalType.description: If a standard type doesn't suit, you can specify a logical type. This is a logical representation of an underlying value, like a timestamp is the number of milliseconds since 1970-01-01T00:00:00.000Z

fullName.description: a full name is a dot separated sequence of one or more simple names (letters, digits and underscores, but doesn't start with a digit), but not equal to a primitive type

simpleName.description: a simple name is an identifier (letters, digits and underscores, but doesn't start with a digit), but not equal to a primitive type

x-intellij-enum-metadata.null: no value; used in unions to make values optional

arrayItems.description: An array must have a schema for the items

items.description: The type of the items of the array.

mapValues.description: A map must have with string keys and a schema for the values

values.description: The type of the values in the map (keys are always strings).

typesWithName.description: Named types must have a name, and can have documentation, a separate namespace, and aliases

name.description: The name of the type. Can be a simple name (with separate namespace) or a full name.

namespace.description: The namespace of the type; ignored if the name is not a simple name.

fixedSize.description: A fixed size type must have a size

size.description: The size (in bytes) of this type.

enumSymbols.description: An enum must have a list of possible symbols, one of which can be the default

default.description: The enum value to use during schema resolution for unknown/unmatched values of the write schema

recordFields.description: A record or error must have a list of fields

logicalTypeValidation.description: All (standard) logical types must have a correct underlying type

precision.description: The number of digits in a decimal logical type.

scale.description: The number of decimal places in a decimal logical type.

default.description: default value, a JSON value that can be mapped to the field schema

aliases.description: Aliases of a schema, field, ... (potentially invalid). Can be used to fix/change/evolve names, but not to relocate elements.

x-intellij-enum-metadata.decimal: arbitrary-precision signed decimal number of the form unscaled Ã— 10^(-scale); annotates fixed or bytes types
x-intellij-enum-metadata.uuid: a universally unique identifier (UUID); annotates a string, formatted as per RFC-4122
x-intellij-enum-metadata.date: a date without time zone; annotates an int type, with the number of days from 1 January 1970 (ISO calendar)
x-intellij-enum-metadata.time-millis: a time of day, with no time zone or date; annotates an int type, with the number of milliseconds since midnight, 00:00:00.000
x-intellij-enum-metadata.time-micros: a time of day, with no time zone or date; annotates a long type, with the number of microseconds since midnight, 00:00:00.000000
x-intellij-enum-metadata.timestamp-millis: an instant on the global timeline; annotates a long type, with the number of milliseconds since 1970-01-01T00:00:00.000Z
x-intellij-enum-metadata.timestamp-micros: an instant on the global timeline; annotates a long type, with the number of microseconds since 1970-01-01T00:00:00.000000Z
x-intellij-enum-metadata.local-timestamp-millis: a timestamp in a local timezone (undefined); annotates a long type, with the number of milliseconds since 1970-01-01T00:00:00.000
x-intellij-enum-metadata.local-timestamp-micros: a timestamp in a local timezone (undefined); annotates a long type, with the number of microseconds since 1970-01-01T00:00:00.000000
x-intellij-enum-metadata.duration: an amount of time defined by a number of months, days and milliseconds; annotates a fixed type with size 12, that stores 3 unsigned, little-endian unsigned integers

request.description: Message request parameters; treated as an anonymous records schema

response.description: Message response type; can be any schema, and void is an alias for the null type

errors.description: Errors that may be the result of the message; must be (references to) 'error' schemas

one-way.description: Whether the message is one-way only. If true, the response schema MUST be null or void
